docs.snippet: The upcoming soccer World Cup in Brazil was supposed to be the party to end all parties.
docs.lead_paragraph: The upcoming soccer World Cup in Brazil was supposed to be the party to end all parties.

headline.main: Days Before World Cup, Much of Brazil Just Not in the Mood
headline.print_headline: Days Before World Cup, Much of Brazil Just Not in the Mood

docs.snippet: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's place in England's World Cup squad looked in jeopardy on Thursday after it was confirmed the Arsenal winger had injured medial knee ligaments in the friendly against Ecuador the previous day.
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's place in England's World Cup squad looked in jeopardy on Thursday after it was confirmed the Arsenal winger had injured medial knee ligaments in the friendly against Ecuador the previous day.

docs.snippet: Frank Lampard is to captain England in the World Cup warm-up against Ecuador while Wayne Rooney will be in the starting lineup again to build his match fitness, manager Roy Hodgson said on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Frank Lampard is to captain England in the World Cup warm-up against Ecuador while Wayne Rooney will be in the starting lineup again to build his match fitness, manager Roy Hodgson said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Lampard to Captain England in Ecuador Warm-Up
headline.print_headline: Lampard to Captain England in Ecuador Warm-Up

docs.snippet: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez jogged on a football pitch on Friday for the first time since knee surgery two weeks ago.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez jogged on a football pitch on Friday for the first time since knee surgery two weeks ago.

headline.main: Suarez Jogs on Field for First Time Since Surgery
headline.print_headline: Suarez Jogs on Field for First Time Since Surgery

docs.snippet: One of the most telling moments of England's World Cup build-up came off the pitch, away from the players, crowds and live TV cameras on the night of a laboured 1-0 win over Denmark at Wembley in March.
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most telling moments of England's World Cup build-up came off the pitch, away from the players, crowds and live TV cameras on the night of a laboured 1-0 win over Denmark at Wembley in March.

headline.main: England Head to Brazil Relying on Youngsters and Luck
headline.print_headline: England Head to Brazil Relying on Youngsters and Luck

docs.snippet: One of the most telling moments of England's build-up to the World Cup came off the pitch, away from the players, crowds and live TV cameras on the night of a laboured 1-0 win over Denmark in their final Wembley warm-up.
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most telling moments of England's build-up to the World Cup came off the pitch, away from the players, crowds and live TV cameras on the night of a laboured 1-0 win over Denmark in their final Wembley warm-up.

docs.snippet: Ireland and Costa Rica played a 1-1 draw in a pre-World Cup exhibition game dubbed as Freedom Cup 2014 on Friday night.

docs.snippet: Handicapping the World Cup can be a tricky business, but the official video game of the tournament, EA Sports’ 2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil, did.

headline.seo: FIFA Video Game Predicts Germany Will Win Cup

docs.snippet: England came up against a resilient Honduras side reduced to 10 men for the last 20 minutes and found themselves short on ideas about how to break them down as they were held to a 0-0 draw in their last World Cup warmup match on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: England came up against a resilient Honduras side reduced to 10 men for the last 20 minutes and found themselves short on ideas about how to break them down as they were held to a 0-0 draw in their last World Cup warmup match on Saturday.

headline.main: Toothless England Held by 10-Man Honduras In Miami
headline.print_headline: Toothless England Held by 10-Man Honduras In Miami

docs.snippet: 64 years after the devastating 1950 World Cup, Maracanã stadium will host another final. Can the home team erase the memory of what happened there the last time?
docs.lead_paragraph: 64 years after the devastating 1950 World Cup, Maracanã stadium will host another final. Can the home team erase the memory of what happened there the last time?
docs.abstract: Maracana Stadium in Rio de Janiero hosted historic loss for the Brazilian national team in 1950 World Cup, and is set to host the final of the World Cup in 2014.

headline.main: This Is What a Cursed Soccer Stadium Looks Like
